title: User calculator navigation basic flow
description: Verify that a user can navigate from the home page using the dynamic dropdown to select and open a calculator for each service module: Civil, Electrical, and HVAC without errors.

steps.description: Navigate to the home page
Open the dynamic calculator dropdown menu
Select a calculator under Civil module
Verify the Civil calculator page loads correctly with no display or functional errors
Return to home page and select a calculator under Electrical module
Verify the Electrical calculator page loads correctly with no errors
Return to home page and select a calculator under HVAC module
Verify the HVAC calculator page loads correctly with no errors

title: Theme upload and validation
description: Verify administrators can upload a new theme at /admin/themes, and that the theme passes all validation checks before activation.

steps.description: Log in as administrator and navigate to /admin/themes
Upload a valid theme package file
Verify theme validation completes successfully with no errors
Attempt to upload an invalid theme package (missing required files)
Verify validation fails with appropriate error messages

title: Theme activation and dynamic CSS application
description: Verify that after activating a validated theme, the theme's dynamic CSS is applied correctly across the application interface.

steps.description: Activate a previously uploaded and validated theme from /admin/themes
Verify that the application frontend reflects the theme styling changes (colors, fonts, layouts)
Navigate through different pages and user interfaces
Verify dynamic CSS is consistently applied and no style regressions or broken layouts occur

title: Theme customization and preview
description: Verify that administrators can customize theme settings at /admin/themes and preview changes before finalizing activation.

steps.description: Navigate to the theme customization section for the active theme
Modify theme parameters such as colors or fonts
Use preview function to view changes without activating
Verify preview displays the customized theme correctly
Save and activate the customized settings
Verify changes are persisted and dynamic CSS applied accordingly

title: Plugin upload and manifest validation
description: Verify that administrators can upload new plugins, and the system validates the plugin manifest to ensure compatibility and integrity.

steps.description: Navigate to the plugin management interface
Upload a plugin package with a valid manifest file
Verify manifest validation succeeds and plugin is listed as available
Upload a plugin with an invalid or missing manifest
Verify plugin upload is rejected with detailed error messages

title: Plugin activation toggle and deletion
description: Verify administrators can toggle plugin activation status and delete plugins safely without system errors or data corruption.

steps.description: Activate an inactive plugin from the plugin list
Verify plugin functionality becomes available and no errors occur
Deactivate an active plugin
Verify plugin features are disabled without adverse effects
Delete a plugin from the system
Verify plugin is removed and no broken references or errors manifest

title: Backup creation and export
description: Verify that administrator can create a full system backup from /admin/help, including database dumps, theme and plugin data, and export the backup files successfully.

steps.description: Navigate to /admin/help and initiate a backup creation
Verify backup process completes without errors and includes db.sql and theme/plugin assets
Download the generated backup archive
Verify the downloaded backup file is complete and uncorrupted

title: Restore from backup
description: Verify that an administrator can restore the system to a previous state using a backup file, and the system recovers fully with all data and configurations intact.

steps.description: Upload a valid backup file via /admin/help restore interface
Initiate the restore process
Verify system completes restore without errors
Verify previously backed up data, themes, plugins, and configurations are fully restored and functional

title: Audit log viewing and filtering
description: Verify that an administrator can access audit logs via /admin/audit-logs, apply various filters (date, user, action), and download filtered log entries without file corruption.

steps.description: Navigate to /admin/audit-logs
Apply filters such as date range, user identity, and action type
Verify audit logs displayed correspond exactly to filter criteria
Download the filtered audit logs as a file
Verify the downloaded file contains expected entries and is not corrupted

title: Admin POST routes security: rate limiting and CSRF protection
description: Verify that all administrative POST routes enforce rate limiting to prevent abuse and validate CSRF tokens to prevent cross-site request forgery.

steps.description: Send multiple rapid POST requests to an admin route with valid CSRF tokens
Verify rate limiting triggers after threshold is crossed and requests are blocked or throttled
Send a POST request without a valid CSRF token
Verify the request is rejected with a CSRF validation error

title: Structured logging and audit logs generation
description: Verify the system logs general events and audit-specific records in a structured format suitable for audit and compliance, and that logs include required details.

steps.description: Perform typical user and admin actions such as login, theme upload, plugin activation, and backup creation
Verify corresponding general logs are created with structured fields (timestamps, user ids, actions)
Verify audit logs capture sensitive or critical changes with detailed context

title: API v1 health endpoint returns 200 OK JSON
description: Verify that the API endpoint /api/v1/health reliably returns a 200 OK HTTP status and a valid JSON response indicating system availability.

steps.description: Send GET request to /api/v1/health
Verify the response status code is 200
Verify the response body is valid JSON containing expected health status information

title: API v1 calculators and history endpoints data validation
description: Verify that API endpoints for calculators and history return correct and complete JSON data in the expected schema without errors.

steps.description: Send GET request to /api/v1/calculators
Verify response is HTTP 200 with valid JSON listing calculators grouped per service module
Send GET request to /api/v1/history for a valid user
Verify response is HTTP 200 with valid JSON containing user calculation history records

title: Edge case: Calculator selection with no available calculators
description: Verify system behavior when no calculators are available under a service module and user attempts to open calculator dropdown.

steps.description: Simulate no calculators available under Electrical module (e.g. by disabling plugins or removing config)
Navigate to home page and open calculator dropdown
Verify Electrical module shows 'No calculators available' or equivalent message
Attempt to select Electrical calculators
Verify user is either prevented or shown a clear error message without UI failure

title: Theme upload with corrupted or partial files
description: Verify that theme uploads with corrupted or partial files are properly rejected by validation and do not break the admin interface.

steps.description: Attempt to upload a theme package with missing mandatory files
Verify validation fails and descriptive error message is shown
Attempt to upload a corrupted theme archive
Verify upload is rejected and no partial data is saved

title: Backup restore with invalid or corrupted backup file
description: Verify that attempting to restore from an invalid or corrupted backup file is safely handled without corrupting the current system state.

steps.description: Upload a corrupted or incomplete backup file via /admin/help restore interface
Attempt to execute the restore process
Verify restore is aborted with an explicit error message
Verify the current system state remains intact and uncorrupted
